title: Accessorize Your Living Room With Stylish Accents
text:
Mansion Global has highlighted these products and services because we think readers will find them useful. We may earn a commission if you buy products through our links, but our recommendations are independent of any compensation that we may receive.

Sure, you may have bespoke furniture pieces in their rightful places, but to really make your living room come alive, adding accessories into the mix gives the room a distinctive point of view. It’s about dressing up your sofa, chairs and end tables with accoutrements that add unique character. From throw pillows and blankets to objets de art, we scoured the market to find six inspired accessories that will add style and substance to your space.



Missoni Humbert Throw

Leave it to Missoni, a couture brand known for its bold, geometric designs, to pull off such a cool looking throw. Missoni

If your sofa feels ho-hum, give it personality with this soft wool Missoni Humbert Throw that imparts chic, fashion-forward flair wherever you place it. There’s something about Missoni’s iconic multicolored zig-zag motif that’s instantly recognizable. And, the poppy hues instantly brighten up your space.



The Missoni Humbert Throw is available for $519.

More: Outdoor Furniture That’s Chic and Will Last From Season to Season

Safavieh 18 by 18-Inch, Peyton Silver Pillow

This neutral pillow goes with almost everything. Amazon

Finding the perfect throw pillows can be a painstaking process that sometimes requires several trips to the store or online returns on repeat. With its neutral suede and leather metallic cowhide print, you’ll never tire of the Safavieh 18 by 18-Inch, Peyton Silver Pillow, which adds fashion-forward flair to the feel of your sofa. Tones of grey, silver and beige mean it pairs well with just about any color scheme. And two pillows come in one set so you can easily round out the look of your couch at once.



The Safavieh 18-by 18-Inch Peyton Silver Pillow is available for around $92.



Harlem Deco Crystal Vase

This Art Deco-style vase adds a certain mid-century chic to your room. MoMA

This MoMA Design Store Harlem Deco Crystal Vase byDanish designers Julie Hugau and Andrea Larsson takes its cue from old-Hollywood glamour and Art Deco design—including New York City skyscrapers. The retro-inspired crystal piece has a multi-hued fan-like form that echoes the decadence and geometry of Art Deco design. It makes enough of a statement to stand alone on a tabletop or fill it with a seasonal bunch of blooms.



The MoMA Design Store Harlem Deco Crystal Vase is available for $400.

Michael Aram Palm Metallic Throw Pillow

When you want a bit of glitz, this metallic throw pillow from Michael Aram may do the trick. Michael Aram

A seamless fit into any décor style, this Michael Aram Palm Metallic Throw Pillowcombines the glamour of silvery metallic with a basket weave motif. Adding a textured touch in a neutral tone like this creates dimension in the room without relying on color or pattern. Pair it with more textured pillows in neutral hues to complete the look.

Michael Aram Palm Metallic Throw Pillow is available for $100.



Rina Menardi Ombre Bowl

An ombre bowl from Rina Menardi echoes the colors of the desert sky and landscape. Rina Menardi

Why fill your end table with tchotchkes when you can display a one-of-a-kind find like this Rina Menardi Ombre Bowl? The pink-nude ombre effect echoes the natural colors of the desert sky and landscape. Crafted by hand in Italy, the stoneware piece lends a bit of elegance to any tabletop.



The Rina Menardi Ombre Bowl is available for $194.
